roleset.name: remove
roleset.note: REMOVE-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Comparison with 'eliminate'. Member of Vncls remove-10.1, banish-10.2, fire-10.10. (from remove.01-v)
REMOVAL-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to remove.01. VN classes remove-10.1, banish-10.2, and fire-10.10. FN class removing. Framed by Katie. (from removal.01-n)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: In a surprise move, [the British government]-1 cleared the way for a bidding war for Jaguar PLC by [*trace*-1]-2 agreeing *trace*-2 to remove an obstacle to a takeover of the auto maker.
example.arg: an obstacle to a takeover of the auto maker

example.name: arg2 as source
example.text: It includes *trace* removing $242 million in good will from the books...

example.name: arg2 as role
example.text: The announcement effectively removes the British government as an impediment to a takeover of the company, which is being stalked by General Motors and Ford.
example.arg: as an impediment to a takeover of the company, which is being stalked by General Motors and Ford

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: speeding the removal of harmful chemicals from the food supply

roleset.name: able to be taken away
roleset.note: REMOVABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on Medi-Tmprl1to8. Relation to 'remove.01'. (from removable.01-j)

example.name: arg1, MNR
example.text: I will be in touch either through the patient or through Dr. Rivera in followup in terms of whether she goes to surgery or whether he feels this might be something that might be amenable to endoscopic removal , but from talking with Dr. Howard it sounds like it probably is not endoscopically removable , and she will probably need an operation .
